page.title: 14LEISURE IN SWANMORE
page.content: In Swanmore people who are different ages like different things. Most elderly ladies like talking about knitting, sewing and cooking. At the Lunch Club they can do all that as well as read the paper. Now for someone a lot younger, the toddler. The Playgroup is a place for toddlers. They paint, draw and make models, as well as go on walks. Now for someone a bit older, the teenager, there is the Friday Club, Youth Club, Swimming, Brownies, Guides, Cubs and Scouts as well as Bowls. Mum and Dad haven't got much of a life. Dad can go to Darts, Pool, Golf and Cricket. Mum can go to the Women's Institute and Saint Barnabas Wives, Keep Fit or Evening Classes. {Tony Ryder}
